iTunes Transitions Gone Sour

Shortened:

http://jpcody.in/2c

Dated:

21 April 2010

I wish iTunes had some sort of feature to stop playing after the current album. Here are alphabetical artist transitions that can bring any sort of zone I'm in, focus I have, or enjoyment of mine to a grinding and complete halt.

  • Bon Iver to Bone Thugs-N-Harmony—From folksy falsetto to Flowmotion in two seconds flat. The most common and egregious transition.
  • The Album Leaf to The Fantastic Mr. Fox soundtrack—Think chill, electronic post-rock. Then think of a hillbilly hoe down.
  • Dixie Chicks to DJ Danger Mouse—Their Home album is thoughtful, and slow, and reflective. DJ Danger Mouse is Jay-Z plus the Beatles.
  • Explosions in the Sky to Falco—Instrumental post-rock to Rock Me, Amadeus. Oh yeah.
  • Radiohead to Rascal Flatts—A very, very swift transition from electronica to embarrassing.
  • AC/DC to Alabama—I've never hit this one in day-to-day life as I don't listen much to either. But the thought is downright scary.
